content.description: Start on low sloper and move left to a big flake. Then head right, using big hold around the lip. Top it out! A short climb but pretty fun.
content.location: Coming from Rocky Glen Pond area, head right off the Switchback trail around marker 16, just before a large rock formation that is very close to the trail on the right. You will see rock on the right and the left. This climb is on the right side. It's about 150 feet from the trail. On clear days, you can actually see this climb from the trail, because the angled rock formation is very recognizable.

content.description: Start on low left undercling with right hand on the arete. Cross to arete off chossy foot. Bump off small crimp to a high slopey right hand, then pull your chest left over a high foot to an easy top out.
content.location: Located on Goldfish boulder. This climb faces the little stream that goes under the small wood bridge. From the wood bridge, there is an obvious boulder and this climb is directly behind that boulder. On the same boulder as Finding Nemo and Finding Dori.

content.description: Lowball traverse. Start low and to the left with right hand on a small crescent.  Traverse through edges using a left heel and then gain the edge using a slopey right hand and left side-pulls to a tricky mantel finish.
content.protection: Two pads helps with the traverse. Some rocks on the group around the top out.
content.location: On the Goldfish boulder, which is a good sized boulder in the middle of this area. From the trail, head right before the rock formation and then you will see this boulder to your left. Finding Nemo and Find Dori are visible from this direction.

content.description: Start on hollow flake to the right. Move up and left to tricky mantle top out, the same as Finding Nemo.
content.location: On the Goldfish boulder, which is a good sized boulder in the middle of this area. From the trail, head right before the rock formation and then you will see this boulder to your left. Finding Nemo and Find Dori are visible from this direction.

content.description: A collection of boulders around marker 16 on the Switchback bike trail.
